title: Leonster's Gate
opening: Having breached Fort Nordrhein, the Liberation Army finally stood before the gates of Leonster. Yet their fight was far from over: a battalion of Imperial troops, even larger in number than the one at Fort Nordrhein, awaited them...

intro.speaker: Gustav
intro.line: I see you've yet to deal with the rebels, Nicolov. Explain yourself!

intro.speaker: Nicolov
intro.line: Ah... Kempf's bravado got the better of him, and he broke rank for his own personal glory. He ruined our chance to halt the rebels' advance... You have my sincerest apologies!

intro.speaker: Gustav
intro.line: Dammit, Kempf! I give him a second chance and this is how he repays me?! I should've sent him back to Castle Friege, like you said.

intro.speaker: Nicolov
intro.line: No, sir, it was me that was too lenient with him... But despite Kempf's failure, I'm not worried. I've stationed my squad of heavily-armored knights in front of the castle. Bishop Mua and his team of mages are also present. Next, we have Reinhardt and the Gelbenritter already approaching the enemy from behind. And if that wasn't enough, we have the Pegasus Corps of Silesse on stand-by, ready to assist us if things go south. With this much strength behind us, we could defeat any army!

intro.speaker: Gustav
intro.line: Indeed... I can find no fault in what you've outlined. Ah, one other thing. I forgot to mention it, but Bishop Saias will be gracing us with his presence. He happened to be traveling nearby, and graciously offered to lend us his power.

intro.speaker: Nicolov
intro.line: THE Bishop Saias? The military genius?!

intro.speaker: Gustav
intro.line: The one and only! His missive said he'd be arriving in a few hours.

intro.speaker: Nicolov
intro.line: Hah! This just isn't the rebels' lucky day, is it? In light of this, I'll shore up our defenses for the time being. Once the Lord Tactician arrives, we'll launch our assault immediately. Marquess Gustav, I bid you remain in the castle and await word of our victory.

intro.speaker: Gustav
intro.line: Very well. I'm counting on you, Nicolov!

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: I'll not lie to you, my prince: the enemy's formation is nearly flawless.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: How so?

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: The main problem is the band of Silessian mercenaries positioned in the northwest. If we advance towards the castle, they'll cut us down from behind.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: Why not divide our forces and send a team to attack them first?

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: We don't have the men to spare. Half our troops were left behind to defend against Reinhardt and his army striking from the rear.

intro.speaker: Leif
intro.line: So what should we do?

intro.speaker: August
intro.line: How willing to fight are the Silessian mercenaries? That is the question...

intro.speaker: Nicolov
intro.line: Do you understand the plan, Captain Misha?

intro.speaker: Misha
intro.line: ...Yeah, I got it.

intro.speaker: Nicolov
intro.line: Very good. And if you'll pardon the intrusion, there's one other matter...

intro.speaker: Misha
intro.line: That being?

intro.speaker: Nicolov
intro.line: I've heard tell your mother was killed by the traitor Sigurd during the civil war. Is that true?

intro.speaker: Nicolov
intro.line: Ah. I take it that's why you became a mercenary fighting on behalf of the Empire?

intro.speaker: Misha
intro.line: This isn't about my mother. Back home, we've got lots of starving children. We're doing this for them. All we want is enough coin to buy bread and milk...

intro.speaker: Nicolov
intro.line: I see... Bah, that was a foolish thing to ask. Please, forget I said anything.

intro.speaker: Misha
intro.line: ...Then I'll be taking my leave.

battle.speaker: Saias
battle.line: Colonel Nicolov! It's been quite some time.

battle.speaker: Nicolov
battle.line: Oh, Bishop Saias! We've been waiting for you, sire!

battle.speaker: Saias
battle.line: How goes the battle?

battle.speaker: Nicolov
battle.line: The enemy fights with an... unexpected ferocity. We're having some slight difficulties. Ah, but having the Bishop of Flame at our side is sure to boost morale! Why, I can already see a marked improvement!

battle.speaker: Saias
battle.line: Have Commander Reinhardt and the Gelbenritter arrived yet?

battle.speaker: Nicolov
battle.line: I expect them to be here any moment—they'll descend upon the enemy's rear guard like vultures to carrion.

battle.speaker: Saias
battle.line: Then now is the perfect time to launch a full-frontal assault. Send word to the Silessian mercenaries.

battle.speaker: Nicolov
battle.line: It shall be done, sire!

battle.speaker: Leif
battle.line: W-What is the meaning of this?! The enemy's morale is suddenly sky-high!

battle.speaker: Dorias
battle.line: My greatest fear... Prince Leif, we cannot hesitate for even a moment—we must order a retreat at once!

battle.speaker: Leif
battle.line: What are you talking about?! Explain yourself, please!

battle.speaker: Dorias
battle.line: Saias, the Royal Bishop of House Velthomer and a military genius, has taken the field. As long as he commands the enemy, we don't stand a chance!

battle.speaker: Leif
battle.line: There's been such a person in the Empire all along?

battle.speaker: August
battle.line: Ah... I'll give you the short version: he's the son of the late General Aida, who was a close friend and confidante of Emperor Arvis. After she passed away—under most puzzling circumstances, I might add—he was raised in a Bragian monastery.

battle.speaker: Leif
battle.line: ...I understand. But it's not that simple—we stand to lose countless soldiers if I call for a retreat now! What should I do...?

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Now's our chance to wipe out the rebels! Lower the bridge over the river!

battle.speaker: Mueller
battle.line: Damn... I didn't think it would take this long to get here. There's no time to waste—order the whole army to charge!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: General Muller? What happened to Commander Reinhardt?

battle.speaker: Mueller
battle.line: He's left for Conote with Princess Ishtar. I'm not privy to the details, but Her Highness was acting strangely... I'd imagine he was worried about her.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: He left to babysit the princess instead of coming to battle? What kind of soldier is he?!

battle.speaker: Mueller
battle.line: A better one than you'll ever be! Now shut your mouth—you're insulting the chain of command!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: Agh! F-Forgive me, General, I meant nothing by it!

battle.speaker: Mueller
battle.line: Still, this IS going to make things harder on us...

battle.speaker: Ishtar
battle.line: Bishop Saias, is this where you've gone?

battle.speaker: Saias
battle.line: Hm? Princess Ishtar? And Commander Reinhardt, too? Whatever is the matter? You look panicked!

battle.speaker: Ishtar
battle.line: It's Prince Julius... He's fallen terribly ill! He's running a high fever, and seems to be in great pain...

battle.speaker: Saias
battle.line: The prince has always had a frail constitution, but his health has been declining as of late... What of the Loptian bishops? Can they do anything?

battle.speaker: Ishtar
battle.line: I won't allow it! As long as I draw breath, they'll not come near him!

battle.speaker: Saias
battle.line: Even Archbishop Manfroy?! Why?

battle.speaker: Ishtar
battle.line: Shouldn't you know that better than anyone, Royal Bishop Saias? Please, you have to see things my way!

battle.speaker: Saias
battle.line: ...I understand. I'll see if I can be of some help. Where is His Highness?

battle.speaker: Ishtar
battle.line: Back in Conote, in my chambers.

battle.speaker: Saias
battle.line: Very well... Let us be off, Princess Ishtar!

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: What? Bishop Saias is leaving for Conote? Not good... We have to shore up our defenses! Destroy that bridge!

recruit-talk.speaker: Karin
recruit-talk.line: Captain Misha?! Hey, last I checked, Silesse wasn't all buddy-buddy with the Empire! Why are you on their side?!

recruit-talk.speaker: Misha
recruit-talk.line: I have something to protect. Simple as that.

recruit-talk.speaker: Misha
recruit-talk.line: None of your damn business, that's what. Off with you, now! The battle is just getting started!

recruit-visit.speaker: Bishop
recruit-visit.line: Ah, Sara, where do you think you're going?

recruit-visit.speaker: Bishop
recruit-visit.line: Oh, are you with the Liberation Army? Did this young woman say something to you? Please, don't put too much stock into it. The girl sometimes blurts out the strangest nonsense... She's a bit touched in the head, I'm afraid.

recruit-visit.speaker: Bishop
recruit-visit.line: B-But they said they were with the army—Ah, Sara, wait!

recruit-visit.speaker: Sara
recruit-visit.line: Go... Take me with you, you have to take me with you...

boss.speaker: Nicolov
boss.line: As if you could defeat me! Tch... Have at you!

boss.speaker: Nicolov
boss.line: Ugh... Not bad... Guess I couldn't do it... after all...

boss.speaker: Moore
boss.line: Loptous, O Lord God... I give myself... to your new era...

boss.speaker: Mueller
boss.line: Now you'll see why the Gelbenritter are so feared!

boss.speaker: Mueller
boss.line: Ergh... It's unthinkable... We stand... defeated...

boss.speaker: Saias
boss.line: Sheathe your weapon. You cannot best me.

recruit-battle.speaker: Misha
recruit-battle.line: Ugh... Deet'var, my beloved mother... I'll see you soon...

recruit-battle.speaker: Misha
recruit-battle.line: I thank you for your mercy, but I still have to fight.

end.speaker: Dorias
end.line: We've managed to capture the castle gates, but many more foes doubtless await us inside. Don't let your guard down, Prince Leif.

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Then we've little choice but to eliminate them all at once, excessive though it may seem. The man inside, Marquess Gustav, is King Bloom's right-hand man—and he's been ruling Leonster with an iron fist. How many people have died at his whim...?

end.speaker: August
end.line: Kill Gustav and hang his head from the castle gates. Don't waste your mercy on him—you must fulfill your duty as ruler!

end.speaker: Dorias
end.line: Prince Leif, we've captured the commander of the Silessians. What shall we do with her?

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: Let her through, please. I want to have a look at her. Is it true you're the commander of the Silessian forces?

end.speaker: Misha
end.line: This is a waste of time... I don't expect mercy from you. Just kill me and get it over with!

end.speaker: Dorias
end.line: This isn't going to work, Prince. The Pegasus Knights of Silesse value honor above all. After leading her troops to their death, the shame would be too much to bear, especially as a prisoner. We should grant her death, as she wishes—that would be mercy.

end.speaker: Karin
end.line: Duke Dorias, don't say something so stupid! Captain Misha, you have something to protect, don't you? How will you do that if you die here?! Those poor kids in Silesse are depending on you! You haven't thought about them!

end.speaker: Misha
end.line: Ah! ...How do you know about that?

end.speaker: Karin
end.line: I asked one of your troops. I saw her lying on the battlefield and tried to help... that was when she told me. I didn't know how many people were going hungry in the places where the Empire is still in charge... So many children, thin as a blade of grass... Just wasting away... She told me she'd hired on with the Empire just to buy food.

end.speaker: August
end.line: Lady Misha, don't you see the irony? It's almost funny, in a macabre way. By helping the Empire, you're sacrificing the children of another country to save the children of your own country. The Empire is conducting child hunts in Thracia—and it won't be long until they do the same in Silesse. Who will protect Silesse's children then?

end.speaker: Misha
end.line: Child hunts...? What in blazes are you talking about?

end.speaker: Leif
end.line: So you don't know... Then I want you to live a little longer and see the truth for yourself. I sentence you to live—to bear witness to our pain and suffering!

end.speaker: Misha
end.line: ...I'm sorry, I'm a little overwhelmed, here. Just give me some time. I need to think...
